comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
” war of the states” is coming
American governance is lost in our beleaguered court system.
If only these states put the same effort in to stopping COVID as they do with stopping COVID safety measures or fighting election fraud that didn't happen.

Let me guess…Texas Florida Georgia North Carolina South Carolina Tennessee Missouri Oklahoma Arizona New Mexico Kentucky West Virginia Louisiana Mississippi Kansas Indiana Nebraska Iowa South Dakota???

"19 republican States want as many people to die as possible hoping that non Republican voters are the majority of the death toll."

FTFY
Republicans are such childish cry babies

As if the COVID vaccine is in some way different from all the other mandated vaccines. As if it's unsafe compared to catching the disease statistically. As if this isn't motivated by some tribal "we show those liberal...". Oh wait, never mind.
Have they never heard of the polio vaccine or chicken pox one or tuberculosis vaccine.  All required by federal law, at least for children in schools. Not sure about federal workers or contractors.

States to cross off your visit list:

Alabama

Alaska

Arkansas

Georgia

Idaho

Iowa

Kansas

Missouri

Montana

Nebraska

New Hampshire

South Carolina

North Dakota

South Dakota

Texas

Utah

West Virginia

Wyoming
*19 states want to increase the length of the pandemic and increase pandemic deaths
Good, they will lose and we will be able to figure out who’s a traitor to democracy or not.
I’ll take 19 states you do not want to live in for $500
Guaranteed every one of those 19 states is a shithole.
My fucking state is on that list. They never have a penny to spend on the poor but they can always find unlimited funding for endless bad-faith lawsuits against any democrat in any office anywhere.
